Value.label: Invert switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Remote level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set remotely.

Value.label: Remote duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set remotely.

Value.label: Local level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set locally.

Value.label: Local duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set locally.

Value.label: Orientation
Value.Help: Controls the on/off orientation of the rocker switch

Value.label: Remote dim level increment
Value.Help: Number of dim levels to change for each dim step when remotely commanded

Value.label: Remote dim step duration
Value.Help: Interval between dimming steps when remotely commanded

Value.label: Dim Level Increment
Value.Help: Indicates the number of levels (1-99) to change dimming each step

Value.label: Step Duration
Value.Help: The number of tens of milliseconds (1-255) to delay on each dimming step.

Value.label: Invert switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Remote level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set remotely.

Value.label: Remote duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set remotely.

Value.label: Local level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set locally.

Value.label: Local duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set locally.

Value.label: Invert switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Remote level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set remotely.

Value.label: Remote duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set remotely.

Value.label: Local level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set locally.

Value.label: Local duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set locally.

Value.label: LED Status
Value.Help: Set the LED policy: on if the load is on, off if the load is on, or off all the time

Value.label: Invert switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Beeper
Value.Help: Enable or disable the beeper.

Value.label: Vacation Mode
Value.Help: Prevents all user codes from unlocking the deadbolt. Enable for extra security while you are away for an extended period of time.

Value.label: Lock & Leave
Value.Help: When enabled: Press the Outside Schlage Button to lock the deadbolt. (Default setting). When disabled: Press the Outside Schlage Button and then enter a user code to lock the deadbolt.

Value.label: Electronic failed count
Value.Help: Each failed electronic attempt increments this count by one.

Value.label: Auto lock
Value.Help: When enabled, the lock will automatically relock 30 seconds after unlocking. (Disabled by default.)

Value.label: User code pin length
Value.Help: User Code PIN length, a value between 4 and 8. IMPORTANT: All user codes must be the same length.

Value.label: Electrical High Preload Transition Count
Value.Help: A subset of Electronic transition count, the number of transitions with high preload.

Value.label: Bootloader Version
Value.Help: The version of the bootloader

Value.label: IN1 Alarm Cancellation Delay
Value.Help: Flood alarm cancellation delay. Additional delay after a flood alarm has ceased. The parameter allows you to specify additional time, after which the flood alarm is cancelled once its violation has ceased.

Value.label: Acoustic and visual signals
Value.Help: Acoustic and visual signals in case of flooding.

Value.label: Type of alarm frame for association group 1
Value.Help: Type of alarm frame for association group 1, activated by flood sensor. The parameter allows to specify the type of alarm frame or to force transmission of control commands (BASIC_SET)

Value.label: Forced Level of Dimming group 1
Value.Help: Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming / opening sun blinds when comes "switch on" / "open" command to devices from association group no. 1. In the case of alarm frames the alarm priority is specified. Possible parameter settings: (1 to 99) and 255. Value of 255 makes it possible to activate the device when using the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to the previous stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, then deactivated, and then reactivated using command 255, it will automatically be set to the previous condition, i.e. 30%.

Value.label: Deactivate transmission of frame cancelling alarm
Value.Help: Deactivating transmission of the frame cancelling the alarm or the control frame deactivating the device (Basic). It allows for disabling the deactivation function or the alarm cancellation function for devices associated with the appropriate input of the Fibaro Sensor. NOTE: Information concerning alarm violation or activation commands for devices from association groups are always sent.

Value.label: Interval between successive readings of temperature sensors
Value.Help: Interval between successive readings of temperature from all sensors connected to the device in seconds. Note: taking temperature readings from the sensor does not result in sending a temperature condition report to the central hub.

Value.label: Insensitiveness to temperature changes.
Value.Help: Insensitiveness to temperature changes. This is the maximum acceptable difference between the last reported temperature and the current temperature taken from the sensor. If the temperatures differ by the set value or more, then a report with the current temperature value is sent to the device assigned to association group no. 3. Intervals between taking readings from sensors are specified by parameter no. 10. Possible parameter settings:1 to 1000 [each 0.01oC] [0.01oC to 10.00oC].

Value.label: Transmitting the alarm or control frame broadcast mode
Value.Help: Transmitting the alarm or control frame in "broadcast" mode (i.e. to all devices within range), information sent in this mode is not repeated by the mesh network. NOTE: If the broadcast mode of information transmission is activated for a given channel, then transmission of information in singlecast mode to devices assigned to the association group of this channel is deactivated.

Value.label: Low temperature alarm threshold.
Value.Help: The parameter stores a temperature value, below which LED indicator blinks with a colour determined by Parameter 61 settings. By default the LED indicator blinks blue. Possible parameter settings:-10000 to 10000 [each 0.01oC] [-100oC to 100oC].

Value.label: High temperature alarm threshold.
Value.Help: The parameter stores a temperature value, above which LED indicator blinks with a colour determined by Parameter 62 settings. By default the LED indicator blinks red. Possible parameter settings:-10000 to 10000 [each 0.01oC] [-100oC to 100oC].

Value.label: Low temperature alarm indicator colour.
Value.Help: The parameter stores RGB colour value.

Value.label: High temperature alarm indicator colour.
Value.Help: The parameter stores RGB colour value.

Value.label: Managing a LED indicator under standard operation.
Value.Help: Parameter determines LED indicator's operation. Set to 0 turns the indicator off, saving battery life.

Item.label: LED indicates temperature (blink) every Temperature Measurement Interval (Parameter 10, constant power + battery) or Wake Up Interval (battery)
LED indicates temperature constantly, only in constant power mode.

Value.label: Temperature measurement compensation.
Value.Help: Parameter stores a temperature value to be added to or deducted from the current temperature measured by the internal temperature sensor in order to compensate the difference between air temperature and the temperature at floor level. Possible parameter settings:-10000 to 10000 [each 0.01oC] [-100oC to 100oC].

Value.label: Alarm frame sent to group 2 (tamper/tilt).
Value.Help: The device is able to turn on alarms resulting from sensors vibrations, e.g. when the sensor is moved, or the TMP button is released. Group 2 association alarms are not cancelled.

Item.label: Button and movement tamper alarms ACTIVE

Value.label: Visual and audible alarm duration
Value.Help: Parameter determines a time period after which alarm will become 'quiet' - still active but the device will go into battery saving mode. Visual or acoustic alarm will be reactivated after time period specified in Parameter 76. When alarm status ceases, alarm will be turned off immediately. Value of 0 means visual and acoustic alarms are active indefinitely. In battery power mode the device will never go to sleep which may shorten battery life significantly.

Value.label: Alarm frame/basic set frame retransmission time
Value.Help: Parameter determines a time period after which an alarm frame will be retransmitted. Value of 0 cancels an alarm frame retransmission.

Value.label: Flood sensor functionality turned off.
Value.Help: Allows for turning off the internal flood sensor. Tamper and internal temperature sensors will remain active.

Value.label: Beeper
Value.Help: Enable or disable the beeper.

Value.label: Vacation Mode
Value.Help: Prevents all user codes from unlocking the deadbolt. Enable for extra security while you are away for an extended period of time.

Value.label: Lock & Leave
Value.Help: When enabled: Press the Outside Schlage Button to lock the deadbolt. (Default setting). When disabled: Press the Outside Schlage Button and then enter a user code to lock the deadbolt.

Value.label: Lock Alarm Mode
Value.Help: The alarm is turned off by default. After installation, you will need to turn on your alarm. Activity Alarms when the door opens or closes. Perfect for monitoring doors while you re at home. After the alarm is triggered, there is a built-in 3-second delay for it to reset. Sounds two short beeps. Tamper Alarms when the lock is disturbed, while locked. Senses subtle activity at the lock. Sounds 15 second Alarm (90 dB) Forced Entry Alarms when significant force pushes against the door, while locked. Perfect for nighttime or when you re away from home. Least sensitive mode Sounds three-minute shrill, steady alarm (90 dB)

Value.label: Activity Alarm Sensitivity
Value.Help: Each alarm mode is preset to a sensitivity level of three. If your alarm is sounding too frequently, or not frequently enough, try changing this setting. If you change the alarm mode, the sensitivity will revert back to the default setting.

Value.label: Tamper Alarm Sensitivity
Value.Help: Each alarm mode is preset to a sensitivity level of three. If your alarm is sounding too frequently, or not frequently enough, try changing this setting. If you change the alarm mode, the sensitivity will revert back to the default setting.

Value.label: Forced Entry Alarm Sensitivity
Value.Help: Each alarm mode is preset to a sensitivity level of three. If your alarm is sounding too frequently, or not frequently enough, try changing this setting. If you change the alarm mode, the sensitivity will revert back to the default setting.

Value.label: Disable Local Alarm Controls
Value.Help: Enables/Disables local alarm on/off, mode change, sensitivity changes

Value.label: Electronic failed count
Value.Help: Each failed electronic attempt increments this count by one.

Value.label: Auto lock
Value.Help: When enabled, the lock will automatically relock 30 seconds after unlocking. (Disabled by default.)

Value.label: User code pin length
Value.Help: User Code PIN length, a value between 4 and 8. IMPORTANT: All user codes must be the same length.

Value.label: Electrical High Preload Transition Count
Value.Help: A subset of Electronic transition count, the number of transitions with high preload.

Value.label: Bootloader Version
Value.Help: The version of the bootloader

Value.label: Orientation
Value.Help: Controls the on/off orientation of the rocker switch

Value.label: Remote dim level increment
Value.Help: Number of dim levels to change for each dim step when remotely commanded

Value.label: Remote dim step duration
Value.Help: Interval between dimming steps when remotely commanded

Value.label: Dim Level Increment
Value.Help: Indicates the number of levels (1-99) to change dimming each step

Value.label: Step Duration
Value.Help: The number of tens of milliseconds (1-255) to delay on each dimming step.

Value.label: Invert switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Remote level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set remotely.

Value.label: Remote duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set remotely.

Value.label: Local level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set locally.

Value.label: Local duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set locally.

Value.label: Invert switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Remote level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set remotely.

Value.label: Remote duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set remotely.

Value.label: Local level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set locally.

Value.label: Local duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set locally.

Value.label: Basic set command
Value.Help: Enable / disable the basic set command send to group 2

Value.label: Value for basic set command
Value.Help: Define BASIC SET VALUE to nodes associated with group 2 when flooding alarm is triggered and is canceled.

Item.label: 255 alarm is triggered, 0 alarm is canceled
0 alarm is triggered, 255 alarm is canceled

Value.label: Leak report interval
Value.Help: Leak report interval, minutes. O to disable.

Value.label: Shock sensor
Value.Help: When the value is Disable, the product will not sends a vibration alarm after moving or shaking. When the value is Enable, the product will sends a vibration alarm after moving or shaking.

Value.label: Temperature report interval
Value.Help: Temperature report interval, minutes. O to disable.

Value.label: High temperature trigger value
Value.Help: Set the high temperature alarm trigger value. Available: -670 to 2570 (-67.0 to 257.0 F) Default: 1040 (104.0 F)

Value.label: Low temperature trigger value
Value.Help: Set the low temperature alarm trigger value. Available: -670 to 2570 (-67.0 to 257.0 F) Default: 320 (32.0 F)

Value.label: Blinking LED when alarm triggers
Value.Help: When the value is Disable, the product will not alarm when being triggered. When the value is Enable, the product will alarm when being triggered.

Value.label: Low battery threshold
Value.Help: Low battery reporting threshold, %.

Value.label: LED Light
Value.Help: When shipped from the factory, the LED is set to turn ON when the connected light is turned OFF. This is the default setting and can be changed if your primary controller supports the node configuration function. To make the LED turn ON when the light is turned ON, change parameter 3s value to 1. To turn the LED OFF at all times, change parameter 3s value to 2.

Item.label: LED Light on when Z-Wave turned OFF
LED Light on when Z-Wave turned ON

Value.label: Overload Protection
Value.Help: turns relay off once voltage exceeds 16.5A for over 5 secs if enabled

Value.label: On/Off Status Recovery After Power Failure
Value.Help: Recovery state for power failure

Value.label: On/Off Status Change Notifications
Value.Help: Send notifications to associated devices

Value.label: LED Indicator Control
Value.Help: LED Indicator Control

Item.label: Display power consumption at state change

Value.label: Power Report Value Threshold
Value.Help: Minimum change in watts to report

Value.label: Power Report Percentage Threshold
Value.Help: Minimum percentage change to report

Value.label: Power Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report power consumption (W) in secs

Value.label: Energy Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report energy usage (KWH) in secs

Value.label: Voltage Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report voltage (V) in secs

Value.label: Electricity Report Frequency
Value.Help: How often to report electrical current (A) in secs

Value.Help: turns relay off once voltage exceeds 16.5A for over 5 secs if enabled
